thought.text: Let me try to work around this by directly importing the modules I need without building the full package. Since the issue is specifically about ASCII table writing, I should be able to work with the relevant modules directly.

action.command: cd /tmp/tmpqkw8olt_/astropy && python -c "import sys; sys.path.insert(0, '.'); from astropy.io.ascii import rst; print('RST module imported successfully')"

function.arguments: {"command": "cd /tmp/tmpqkw8olt_/astropy && python -c \"import sys; sys.path.insert(0, '.'); from astropy.io.ascii import rst; print('RST module imported successfully')\"", "security_risk": "LOW"}
function.name: execute_bash
